Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Dexketoprofen/Tramadol for Postoperative Pain Management

Trial_Design.evidence: multicentre, randomised, double-blind, double-dummy, placebo- and active-controlled trial

Participants.evidence: 641 patients aged 18–80 years were enrolled across 37 sites in 10 countries

Intervention.evidence: dexketoprofen/tramadol 25 mg/75 mg fixed-dose combination compared to dexketoprofen 25 mg and tramadol 100 mg

Objective.evidence: This study evaluated the analgesic efficacy and safety of a dexketoprofen/tramadol 25 mg/75 mg fixed-dose combination

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the mean sum of pain intensity differences (SPID) over 8 hours post-dose

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: randomised using an Interactive Voice/Web Response system with allocation concealment

Number_Randomised.evidence: 641 patients were randomised: 213 to dexketoprofen/tramadol, 214 to dexketoprofen, and 214 to tramadol

Number_Analysed.evidence: 641 patients were randomised: 213 to dexketoprofen/tramadol, 214 to dexketoprofen, and 214 to tramadol

Result_Outcome.evidence: The mean SPID 8 values were 247 for dexketoprofen/tramadol, 209 for dexketoprofen, 205 for tramadol, and 151 for placebo. The combination was superior to dexketoprofen (P=0.019) and tramadol (P=0.012)

Harms.evidence: Adverse drug reactions were low and similar across groups, with 2.8% in the combination group, 4.7% in the dexketoprofen group, and 5.1% in the tramadol group
